title: Pilot
description: Ernest Frye, a holier-than-thou Deacon, is seeking a new minister for the First Community church.

title: The Courtship of Bess Richards
description: Deacon Frye tries to woo a gospel singer to sing at his church, but she thinks he wants to marry her.

title: The Morning After
description: Poor Thelma's cooking leaves Reverend Gregory intoxicated by her wine-soaked dinner.

title: The Deacon Delivers
description: The Deacon winds up delivering a baby from the unwed teenager in the Church choir.

title: Rolly Falls in Love
description: Rolly asks the Deacon to ask out a waitress for him, and the Deacon decides to ask her out himself.

title: Retreat, Heck!
description: Deacon Frye decides to go to a church retreat so he can avoid an angry former client who is now getting out of jail.

title: Sermon from the Cell
description: The Deacon is jailed for contempt after defending Reverend Gregory who has been giving refugees sanctuary.

title: Maitre D'eacon
description: A church member leaves bequeaths her restaurant to them with the stipulation that they cannot sell it as long as it is successful.

title: Reuben's Romance
description: Reverend Gregory has a guilty conscience after a widow he is consoling becomes a little more to him.

title: After the Fall
description: After Rolly falls at the bank, the Deacon makes sure Rolly is awarded a settlement, but Rolly refuses it.

title: Your Christmas Show of Shows
description: Church members work hard to try and finish the preparations for the Christmas pageant which could end up on TV, but snow dampens the festive mood.

title: Frye for the Defense
description: A fund-raiser replete with rigged games, tainted salad and a lawsuit against the church brings more trouble than reward for the good Reverend.

title: Thelma's Choice
description: The new man in Thelma's life seems like Mr. Right to everyone, even the Deacon.

title: Betting on the Boy
description: The Deacon is glad to be a Big Brother when he realizes his charge may help him win bets.

title: Casting the First Stone
description: Lorenzo admits to an affair with an unnamed woman, which starts the congregation speculating and creates embarrassment for Reverend Gregory.

title: Yes Sir, That's Your Baby
description: The Hetebrink sisters adopt a baby, but an 18-year-old shows up.

title: Into the Night
description: Deacon Frye is stuck escorting Reverend Gregory's aunt out on the town, but winds up loosening her up too much so that she ends up in jail.

title: The Divorce Lawyer
description: The Deacon devotes himself to his law practice when the board appoints Rolly as its new chairman.

title: The Rival
description: Reverend Gregory falls in love with the new Sunday-school teacher, leaving Thelma heartbroken.

title: The Magician
description: The Deacon's magic act flops before the church board, which is selecting entertainment for a charity bash, but it impresses a burglar out to rob the choir hall.

title: Glen Garry Glen Thelma
description: Thelma may lose a big commission as a real-estate agent thanks to the Deacon.

title: What's Up, Deacon?
description: The Deacon turns over a new leaf in an effort to be the church's nominee for a humanitarian award, which could win him and Thelma a trip to the Holy Land.

title: California Dreaming
description: Reverend Gregory accepts a job in California, much to Thelma's dismay.

title: Dancing in the Dark
description: The Deacon accepts an offer to work for his old law school rival and finds the man as competitive as ever.

title: You Bet Your Life
description: Amelia's old gambling habit returns after she wins a new car in the church raffle.

title: Dueling Ministers
description: Reverend Gregory finds himself in competition with a 12-year-old minister.

title: Thelma's Reunion
description: Thelma becomes very insecure as her school reunion approaches. She feels she doesn't measure up to her snobby friends.

title: Deacon on the Line
description: The Deacon counsels a troubled teen who phones in.

title: Rolly's Proposal
description: Rolly and Leola decide to move in together.

title: Rolly's Wedding
description: Rolly and Leola prepare for their wedding despite some reservations.

title: Thelma's Birthday
description: When Frye's doctor meets Thelma, he asks her out. When Gregory learns of this, he acts jealous. When they go to her place, Frye who is sick, is constantly asking the doctor to check him out. And Gregory shows up.

title: Thelma's Little Girl
description: Thelma prepares to adopt a child, but the Deacon wonders if she's ready for the responsibility.

title: The Twelve Songs of Christmas
description: The Church Choir brings joy to the Christmas festivities as well as Leola and Rolly.

title: Snakes Alive
description: Deacon Frye tries to help Reverend Gregory overcome his fear of snakes.

title: Man on a Ledge
description: Thelma regrets leaving an amorous message on Reverend Gregory's answering machine.

title: To Catch a Thief
description: The Deacon comes to his granddaughter's defense when she's accused of stealing money from the church collection box.

title: The Widow
description: Reuben becomes the object of affection from a very lonely widow.

title: Stranded
description: The Deacon has a spiritual reawakening at a church retreat in the mountains during a snowstorm.

title: Deacon Dearest
description: The Deacon becomes interested in one of the parishes couples which are talking divorce after he learns that the husband is a millionaire.

title: The Fantasy
description: Thelma and Reverend Gregory imagine what life would be like if they were married.

title: Wedding Bell Blues
description: Reverend Gregory is sued for negligent marriage counseling.

title: A Slight Case of Murder (1)
description: Deacon Frye defends a woman accused of murdering her husband and much to everyone's surprise, falls in love with her.

title: A Slight Case of Murder (2)
description: Roxanne makes a surprising revelation after her wedding to Deacon Frye.

title: Fear of Flying
description: The church board's trip to the Bahamas is fraught with problems, including Thelma's fear of flying.

title: Will You Still Love Me Tomorrow?
Look at Me, I'm Running
description: The Deacon decides to run for State Senator and enlists the help of the church board as support staff.

title: Get 'Em Up, Scout
description: A prestigious law firm offers Deacon Frye a job.

title: The Minister's Wife
description: Thelma organizes a church supper to impress Reverend Gregory.

title: The Housekeeper
description: Thelma tired of being treated like a domestic by her father moves out and goes to Gregory. And when people learn of this, they start to talk which could be touchy for Gregory. And Frye hires a housekeeper who likes him.

title: Thelma's Handyman
description: A 19-year-old handyman asks Thelma on a date, and it's not long before the congregation gets the wrong idea about their relationship.

title: The Deacon's Donkey
description: The Deacon takes over as producer of the Christmas pageant, but problems arise when one of the star performers becomes ill.

title: Matchmaker, Matchmaker
description: Deacon Frye agrees to help a wealthy widower find a wife in exchange for a large donation to the church.

title: I Remember Mama
description: Deacon Frye recalls how he met Thelma's mother during the Korean War.

title: The Reverend Ernest Frye
description: Reverend Gregory becomes ill with the measles and has Thelma waiting on him hand and foot.

title: The Green Card
description: Inga's fiancé flees on the day of their wedding.

title: The Psychic (1)
description: Thelma consults a psychic about her future with Reverend Gregory.

title: The Psychic (2)
description: The truth about Tanya DuBois' prediction is revealed, much to Thelma's relief.

title: The Boxer
description: The congregation thinks the Deacon must be punch-drunk for agreeing to manage boxer Windmill Pearson, until Windmill gets into the ring with a contender.

title: Nothing But the Truth
description: Reverend Gregory's mother arrives for a visit and romantically pursues the Deacon.

title: Career Girl
description: Thelma takes a job as a receptionist and earns a big promotion during her first week on the job.

title: First Community Talent Show
description: The church holds a talent show to raise money for charity.

title: The Last Supper
description: Deacon Frye schemes to have Reverend Gregory installed in a prestigious position on the Minister's council.

title: Sing, Sister, Sing
description: Deacon Frye enlists himself as Amelia's talent agent when the owner of a record company shows interest in her voice.

title: A Mind Is a Terrible Thing to Waste
description: Reverend Gregory and Deacon Frye try to help a wayward high-school student by showing him the importance of pursuing a college education.

title: The Engagement
description: Thelma tells a shocked Reverend Gregory to propose by noon or it's over; the whole congregation gathers outside his office waiting for his answer.

title: Where There's a Will
description: The Deacon's estranged father-in-law, who once disowned the Fryes, now lies on his deathbed with a last request for the Deacon.

title: I Can't Help Loving That Man of Mine
description: Gregory's ex shows up and she's gorgeous. When they learn that hes going to be alone with her everyone is worried except Thelma. But later she decides to go where they are. And it turns out she's making a move on Gregory.

title: Who Am I?
description: An amnesiac Thelma displays a new personality and begins dating another man.

title: Witness for the Defense
description: The Deacon discredits himself by mismanaging a murder suspect's defense.

title: TV or Not TV
description: A street gang threatens to stop Reverend Gregory from delivering his sermon on television.

title: Don't Rain on My Shower
description: Thelma goes overboard at her bridal shower to impress her high-school nemesis with reports that she's living the good life.

title: Thelma Says I Do
description: Thelma's wedding day is plagued by disaster.

title: She's in the Army Now: Part 1
description: After her wedding to Gregory doesn't push through, Thelma joins the Army. And after a few days she wants to leave but can't. So Gregory and Frye go there to help her.

title: She's in the Army Now: Part 2
description: Thelma comes to her dad's defense when he's insulted by a drill sergeant.

title: Sergeant in Arms
description: Fearing he's lost Thelma to Sgt. Burke, Rev. Gregory puts up a fight when she comes home on a weekend pass with the sergeant in tow.

title: Thelma Frye, Dough Girl
description: Thelma is home for Christmas, which gives her the opportunity to be the wife-to-be for Reverend Gregory.

title: The Deacon vs. the U.S. Army
description: Thelma's wedding to Reverend Gregory may be put on hold when she receives orders to ship out to Germany.

title: The Roast
description: The deacon is being orated by his friends and family, which includes flashbacks from previous episodes. At the end, the deacon is actually having a dream.

title: The Wedding
description: Reverend Gregory assumes a dual role at his wedding to Thelma when their minister is unable to perform the ceremony.

title: The Honeymoon
description: Thelma and Reuben's plans for a romantic Hawaiian honeymoon are delayed.

title: The Talent Show
description: The church's talent show features rap numbers, choir selections and poetry readings, plus a tribute to New York City philanthropist Mother Hale.

title: Moving In
description: Thelma hosts her first dinner party as Reverend Gregory's wife, but the evening ends in disaster when she sets fire to the kitchen.

title: Trouble in Paradise
description: Thelma worries that Reuben no longer finds her desirable, but he's too embarrassed to admit the real reason for his lack of passion.

title: Who's Sorry Now?
description: Amelia sues Deacon Frye after getting hurt following an argument between them.

title: The Deacon's Confession
description: Deacon Frye admits that he spent Thelma's dowry money, $25,000.

title: Two Men, One Woman and a Baby
Three Men and a Hammer
description: Frye asks a Reverend to speak at the service and his sermon inspires Clarence to drop out of school and pursue his dream of being a rapper like his idol M.C. Hammer. In order to convince Clarence not to Frye tries to get Hammer to speak to him but they can't get in to see him. So he dresses up like a fan.

title: Three's a Crowd
description: Reverend Gregory tries to sympathize with Thelma during her pregnancy.
